page.title: 06Landscape
page.content: The land in this area is undulating, with wooded valleys, some with streams and some with quite steep hills. Rock out-crops are of soft sandstone and there are several caves, one of which was used for many years by on old hermit, who relied opon public generosity for his sustenance. The fields all have mixed hedges, which contain a wide variety of deciduous trees. There is a part of Bishops Wood in this area, which is a conifer plantation, owned by the Forestry Commi sion. It is open to the public for walking and horse riding. The whole area is pleasing to the eye and is a pleasant example of the Heart of England.
